title: Tom Segura - White Girls With Cornrows
description:
Throughout his sophomore release, comedian Tom Segura offers a hilariously cynical view of modern society, poignant ruminations about the people around us and, perhaps most importantly, some words of wisdom, a portion of which center around the title of the album, White Girls with Cornrows.

Self-released by Segura, White Girls takes aim at guys who wear cowboy hats Ã¢â‚¬â€ Ã¢â‚¬Å“I think itÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s time to see an end to the man who walks around in public with a cowboy hat on like heÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s not wearing a cowboy hat in public. That shit is ridiculous.Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½ Ã¢â‚¬â€ to, well, white chicks who wear cornrows. Combining the snarky observations and often ill-spirited rants fans have come to expect from the co-host of the much-loved podcast, Your MomÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s House, Segura takes his audience on a sarcastic comedic temper tantrum as he sharply rips apart his personal obstaclesÃ¢â‚¬â€œ both real and imagined.

The Los Angeles-based, Cincinnati-bred Segura has graced the stage on Conan, has starred in his own Comedy Central Presents and has appeared on Russell Peters Presents on Showtime and Live at GothamÃ¢â‚¬â€œ as well as performing at some of the top comedy festivals in the world, hitting Montreal, Vancouver and Melbourne. So, heÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s most definitely in a position to observe and report about culture. Hence his theory on white girls who wear a style of hairdo made famous by Snoop Dogg: Ã¢â‚¬Å“You can always tell when youÃ¢â‚¬â„¢re in a dicey neighborhood,Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½ Segura cautions, Ã¢â‚¬Å“when you see white girls with cornrowsÃ¢â‚¬Â¦if you ever see a white girl with cornrows, just know that she is down for whatever. You donÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t see it a lot, but where you do see it, is on prison shows.Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½

It seems few topics are off-limits for Segura, but despite how much he has to say about others, he knows that the best humor starts with himself (highlighted by a colorful story about being caught masturbating and a theory about his ever-degenerating ability to have decent sex) or with his family: it seems SeguraÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s cousin Brian thinks heÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s an inventor; by the comedianÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s estimation, however, Ã¢â‚¬Å“heÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s just an asshole.Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½And although Segura can be comfortably classified as critical, he does it with delightfully sardonic over tones reminiscent of Jon Lovitz, combined with a laid-back, Eugene Mirman-like pace that come together to create an hour of comedy that leaves you feeling a bit guilty (and perhaps surprised at yourself) for laughing so heartily at others.
